description: The final major exam of the entire academic session
column8: usually written in May/June or June/July. Covers only second-semester topics
column9: but your result here combines with everything else to determine if you pass or move to the next class/level. Typically 60–70%. Clear this and you’re done for the year – no more tension!

column8: but for the second half of the session (January/February to May/June). All your tests
column12: and attendance during this period count here. Still 30–40% of your final grade. Many students use this semester to boost subjects they were weak in earlier.

description: This is your day-to-day score throughout the first semester (usually August/September to December). It includes quizzes
column13: CA is worth 30–40% of your total grade for each subject. Staying consistent here reduces the pressure on the final exam and keeps your GP high from the start!

description: The main written exam taken at the end of first semester (November/December/January). It tests everything you’ve been taught from the beginning of the session till that point. Usually carries 60–70% of your total grade per subject. Doing well here locks in a strong foundation for the year.
